column1: Jean-Pierre Haigner (born 19 May 1948) is a French Air Force officer and a former CNES astronaut.
Haigner was born in Paris, France and joined the French Air Force, where he trained as a test pilot.
He flew on two missions to the Mir space station in 1993 and 1999.

column2: The Mir Altair long-duration mission (186 days) in 1993 also included an EVA.

column1: He is married to former French astronaut Claudie Haigner.

column2: The asteroid 135268 Haigner is named in their combined honour.

column1: He has three children, two from a previous marriage and one with Claudie Haigner.
